required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Increasing Bone Density by Application of Surface Electrical Stimulation
clinical_study.official_title: Increasing Bone Density by Application of Surface Electrical Stimulation

brief_summary.textblock:
Bonestim system for osteoporosis treatment uses surface electrical stimulation of neuromuscular and skeletal tissue by multipad stimulation electrodes for inducing contractions of the spinal column muscles. The primary aim of this clinical study is to determine if the Bonestim therapy can improve bone density. A secondary aim is to determine whether the applied treatment increases postural stability and facilitation of daily life activities.
Inducing of contractions of the spinal column muscles in this manner could be new treatment options for the patients with reduced mobility and the patients with serious contraindications for drugs.

primary_outcome.measure: density of bone measured by central Dxa measurement

secondary_outcome.measure: sagittal flexibility measured by Schober measurement
daily activities measured by Oswestry disability index

arm_group.description: The experimental group will be treated with the electrical stimulation device Bonestim.

intervention.description: Bonestim is the multipad electrical stimulation device.
intervention.other_name: multipad electrical stimulation of trunk muscles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- T score at least 1,5 (ideal 2,-2,5)
- Stable bone turn over (lab.analyses.)
Exclusion Criteria:
- fracture,pace maker, malignancy and gastrointestinal problems
- chronic corticosteroid therapy
- spinal surgery in previous year

facility.name: Clinic for rehabilitation dr Miroslav Zotovic Faculty of Medicine University of Belgrade
